Class RMIServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • RMIServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, ServerInterface

    public class RMIServer
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ServerInterface
    Class that represents a RMIServer (both Primary and Backup)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • connectToRMIServer

        public void connectToRMIServer()
                        throws java.rmi.AccessException,
                               java.rmi.RemoteException,
                               java.net.MalformedURLException,
                               java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Tries to connect the BackupRMIServer. In case it fails, creates a new connection(becomes the PrimaryRMIServer)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.AccessException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        java.rmi.NotBoundException

      • reconnectClients

        public void reconnectClients()
                      throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                             java.rmi.RemoteException,
                             java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Reconnects all the RMIClients to the new PrimaryRMIServer. This happens when a Primary fails and the Backup has to take its place
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.rmi.NotBoundException

      • checkPrimaryServerStatus

        public void checkPrimaryServerStatus()
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                     java.rmi.AccessException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method where RMIBackupServer lays. Tests the RMIPrimaryServer, as well as gets the necessary data so that when the Primary fails, it has everything needed. Exception is thrown when primary server stops responding.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.rmi.AccessException
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • connectToMulticast

        public java.lang.String connectToMulticast(int clientNo,
                                           java.lang.String msg)
                                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Method used by almost all functionalities to send a multicast message to all the MulticastServers. In case there's no response within 30s, returns a null message.
        Parameters:
        clientNo -
        msg -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • sendRtsToAll

        public void sendRtsToAll(java.lang.String msg)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         java.rmi.NotBoundException
        Method used to send a rts message to all the clients. Only the ones that are in the rts page will see it.
        Parameters:
        msg -
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        java.rmi.NotBoundException
